name: Ivanti Exploitation â€“ CVE-2025-22457, CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887
description: Mapped kill chain and extended behaviors for UNC5221 exploitation of Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA Gateways. Includes TRAILBLAZE dropper, BRUSHFIRE backdoor, and SPAWN ecosystem.

techniques.comment: Initial access via public-facing Ivanti VPN endpoints using buffer overflow and command injection.
Command injection via login.cgi to launch TRAILBLAZE dropper and execute shell payloads.
Persistence via webshell and passive implant in /home/bin/web (BRUSHFIRE).
Tampering with Ivanti integrity checker tool (ICT) to evade detection.
C2 via HTTP/S beaconing from BRUSHFIRE backdoor.
Credential access through harvested VPN session tokens and memory scraping.
Data exfiltration over encrypted channels post-compromise.
Lateral movement via SSH and remote services using SPAWN toolkit.
TRAILBLAZE is packed and Base64-encoded to fit within shell scripts.
BRUSHFIRE masquerades as a legitimate SSL_read hook inside Ivanti VPN process.
Implants modify permissions on /home/bin/web for persistence.
SPAWN tools perform network recon for lateral movement.
Used to identify privileged accounts post-access.
TRAILBLAZE targets running processes for injection.
Recon includes OS fingerprinting and system profiling.
SPAWN tools enumerate file paths for implant placement.
SPAWNSLOTH disables dslogserver and remote syslog forwarding.
Used in lateral movement and remote command execution in hybrid environments.
